017package org.microbean.invoke;
018
019import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
020
021import java.util.function.Supplier;
022
023/**
024 * An {@link OptionalSupplier} that tries one {@link Supplier} first,
025 * before falling back to another one, while properly implementing the
026 * {@link #determinism()} method.
027 *
028 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
029 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
030 */
031public final class DefaultingOptionalSupplier<T> implements OptionalSupplier<T> {
032
033  private final Supplier<? extends T> defaults;
034
035  private final Supplier<? extends T> supplier;
036
037  private volatile Determinism determinism;
038
039  private DefaultingOptionalSupplier() {
040    this(null, null);
041  }
042
043  private DefaultingOptionalSupplier(Supplier<? extends T> supplier) {
044    this(supplier, null);
045  }
046
047  private DefaultingOptionalSupplier(Supplier<? extends T> supplier, Supplier<? extends T> defaults) {
048    super();
049    final Determinism determinism;
050    if (supplier == null) {
051      if (defaults == null) {
052        supplier = Absence.instance();
053        determinism = Determinism.ABSENT;
054      } else if (defaults instanceof OptionalSupplier<? extends T> dos) {
055        supplier = defaults;
056        defaults = Absence.instance();
057        determinism = dos.determinism();
058      } else {
059        supplier = defaults;
060        defaults = Absence.instance();
061        determinism = Determinism.NON_DETERMINISTIC;
062      }
063    } else if (supplier instanceof OptionalSupplier<? extends T> sos) {
064      if (defaults == null) {
065        determinism = sos.determinism();
066      } else if (defaults instanceof OptionalSupplier<? extends T> dos) {
067        final Determinism sd = sos.determinism();
068        final Determinism dd = dos.determinism();
069        if (sd == Determinism.ABSENT) {
070          if (dd == Determinism.ABSENT) {
071            defaults = Absence.instance();
072            determinism = Determinism.ABSENT;
073          } else {
074            supplier = defaults;
075            defaults = Absence.instance();
076            determinism = sd;
077          }
078        } else if (sd == Determinism.PRESENT) {
079          defaults = Absence.instance();
080          determinism = Determinism.PRESENT;
081        } else if (sd == Determinism.DETERMINISTIC) {
082          if (dd == Determinism.DETERMINISTIC) {
083            determinism = Determinism.DETERMINISTIC;
084          } else {
085            determinism = Determinism.NON_DETERMINISTIC;
086          }
087        } else {
088          determinism = Determinism.NON_DETERMINISTIC;
089        }
090      } else {
091        determinism = Determinism.NON_DETERMINISTIC;
092      }
093    } else {
094      determinism = Determinism.NON_DETERMINISTIC;
095    }
096    this.supplier = supplier;
097    this.defaults = defaults;
098    this.determinism = determinism;
099  }
100
101  /**
102   * Returns an {@link Determinism} suitable for this {@link
103   * DefaultingOptionalSupplier}.
104   *
105   * @return a {@link Determinism} suitable for this {@link
106   * DefaultingOptionalSupplier}
107   *
108   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
109   *
110   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
111   *
112   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
113   * threads.
114   */
115  @Override
116  public final Determinism determinism() {
117    return this.determinism;
118  }
119
120  /**
121   * Attempts to return the return value of an invocation of the
122   * {@link Supplier#get()} method on the main {@link Supplier}
123   * supplied {@linkplain #of(Supplier, Supplier) to one of the
124   * factory methods}, unless that invocation causes a {@link
125   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
126   * UnsupportedOperationException} to be thrown, in which case
127   * attempts to return the return value of an invocation of the
128   * {@link Supplier#get()} method on the default {@link Supplier}
129   * supplied {@linkplain #of(Supplier, Supplier) to one of the
130   * factory methods}.
131   *
132   * @return the value in question, which may be {@code null}
133   *
134   * @exception NoSuchElementException if no value is present
135   *
136   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException if no value is present
137   *
138   * @nullability This method may return {@code null} at any point.
139   *
140   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
141   *
142   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
143   * threads.
144   *
145   * @see #of(Supplier, Supplier)
146   */
147  @Override
148  public final T get() {
149    final Determinism d = this.determinism();
150    try {
151      final T value = this.supplier.get();
152      switch (d) {
153      case DETERMINISTIC:
154        // We were told whatever the supplier does it will forever do.
155        // We just didn't know what it would do.  Now we know what it
156        // will do: it will always return a value.  Adjust our
157        // determinism accordingly.
158        this.determinism = Determinism.PRESENT;
159        return value;
160      case PRESENT:
161      case NON_DETERMINISTIC:
162        return value;
163      case ABSENT:
164        throw new IllegalStateException();
165      default:
166        throw new AssertionError();
167      }
168    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
169      switch (d) {
170      case NON_DETERMINISTIC:
171        return this.defaults.get();
172      case DETERMINISTIC:
173        try {
174          return this.defaults.get();
175        } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e2) {
176          this.determinism = Determinism.ABSENT;
177          throw e2;
178        }
179      case ABSENT:
180      case PRESENT:
181        throw new IllegalStateException();
182      default:
183        throw new AssertionError();
184      }
185    }
186  }
187
188
189  /*
190   * Static methods.
191   */
192
193
194  /**
195   * Returns a {@link DefaultingOptionalSupplier} whose {@link #determinism()}
196   * method will always return {@link Determinism#ABSENT} and whose
197   * {@link #get()} method will always throw a {@link
198   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
199   * UnsupportedOperationException}.
200   *
201   * @param <T> the type of object the returned {@link
202   * DefaultingOptionalSupplier} will {@linkplain #get() supply}
203   *
204   * @return a {@link DefaultingOptionalSupplier} whose {@link #determinism()}
205   * method will always return {@link Determinism#ABSENT} and whose
206   * {@link #get()} method will always throw a {@link
207   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
208   * UnsupportedOperationException}
209   *
210   * @nullability This method will never return {@code null}.
211   *
212   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
213   *
214   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
215   * threads.
216   *
217   * @see Absence#instance()
218   *
219   * @see #get()
220   *
221   * @see #determinism()
222   */
223  public static final <T> DefaultingOptionalSupplier<T> of() {
224    return new DefaultingOptionalSupplier<>(null, null);
225  }
226
227  /**
228   * Returns a {@link DefaultingOptionalSupplier} with no defaults.
229   *
230   * @param <T> the type of object the returned {@link
231   * DefaultingOptionalSupplier} will {@linkplain #get() supply}
232   *
233   * @param supplier the {@link Supplier} in question; may be {@code
234   * null} in which case a {@link DefaultingOptionalSupplier} that behaves
235   * identically to an {@link Absence} instance will be returned
236   *
237   * @return a {@link DefaultingOptionalSupplier} with no defaults
238   *
239   * @nullability This method will never return {@code null}.
240   *
241   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
242   *
243   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
244   * threads.
245   *
246   * @see Absence#instance()
247   *
248   * @see #get()
249   *
250   * @see #determinism()
251   */
252  public static final <T> DefaultingOptionalSupplier<T> of(final Supplier<? extends T> supplier) {
253    return new DefaultingOptionalSupplier<>(supplier, null);
254  }
255
256  /**
257   * Returns a {@link DefaultingOptionalSupplier} that will, loosely speaking,
258   * try the supplied {@code supplier} first, and, if it throws a
259   * {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
260   * UnsupportedOperationException} from its {@link Supplier#get()}
261   * method, will then try the supplied {@code defaults}.
262   *
263   * <p>The supplied {@link Supplier} instances can, themselves, be
264   * {@link OptionalSupplier}s, and, if so, the resulting {@link
265   * DefaultingOptionalSupplier} will have its {@link #determinism()} method
266   * appropriately implemented.</p>
267   *
268   * @param <T> the type of object the returned {@link
269   * DefaultingOptionalSupplier} will {@linkplain #get() supply}
270   *
271   * @param supplier the first {@link Supplier} to try; may be {@code null}
272   *
273   * @param defaults the fallback {@link Supplier} to try; may be
274   * {@code null}
275   *
276   * @return a {@link DefaultingOptionalSupplier}
277   *
278   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
279   *
280   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
281   *
282   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
283   * threads.
284   *
285   * @see #get()
286   *
287   * @see #determinism()
288   */
289  public static final <T> DefaultingOptionalSupplier<T> of(final Supplier<? extends T> supplier, final Supplier<? extends T> defaults) {
290    return new DefaultingOptionalSupplier<>(supplier, defaults);
291  }
292
293}
